news.title: Thabani Gonye and Ringisai Mapondera vying for ZOC presidency
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
ZIMBABWE Olympic Committee (ZOC) is set to hold its elective Congress this Sunday, with two candidates, incumbent Thabani Gonye and seasoned administrator, Ringisai Mapondera vying for the presidency.
The elections will take centre stage as all the board positions are up for grabs, save for the Treasurer where Mxolisi Ndlovu is unopposed.
Incumbent Thabani Gonye and current Head of compliance Ringisai Mapondera will go head-to-head for the presidency.
A legal practitioner, Mapondera, who led Zimbabwe as Chef de Mission believes it is time to reignite Zimbabwe’s Olympic dream and is convinced he has the blueprint to tap into sport-tourism synergies to fund Olympic participation as athletes have struggled for funding.
“We can learn from others and try to apply the same to reignite the Olympic movement in Zimbabwe. We always struggled as an organisation to get sponsorship just to fund Olympic participation, but what I saw were eye-opening approaches primarily around tourism.
“You create synergies and I intend to pursue more engagement with the tourism sector. We have a lot of national parks, breathtaking scenery and that can be showcased through the Olympics. The world is watching, and that’s a major advertising opportunity,” Mapondera said.
Mapondera served just one term on the ZOC board and before that he also led the Zimbabwe Volleyball Association for a single term.
Seven candidates are vying for the two vice-president positions including former ZIFA Spokesperson Xolisani Gwesela, media practitioner Merit Munzwembiri and volleyball administrator Fredrick Ndlovu.

news.title: Football academies key in identifying and nurturing young talent
news.content:
Story by Gay Matambo
A new football academy has been established in Chiredzi as part of initiatives meant to identify and nurture young talent while providing a platform for them to develop skills.
Following the establishment of the Lowveld Football Academy, close to 100 budding players are being nurtured.
The youngsters are acquiring technical skills, tactics and physical conditioning, building a solid foundation for future use.
“This academy is good for us because, as a young lady, my dream is to take football as a full-time career when I grow up. Well, such initiatives distance thoughts of getting married early amongst us young girls and we appreciate that,” a female footballer said.
“I am 17 years old and being part of this academy as youths ensures that we do not have time for drug abuse and we are working on pursuing our dreams of playing for big teams in Zimbabwe. At the age of 23, my goal is to be an international footballer by then,” an aspirating footballer said
“I came back from South Africa where I was doing menial jobs there following the establishment of this academy in my home area. This is helping us a lot, and it will give us the exposure we need,” a football player said.

news.title: PSL log leaders MWOS in another stern test of character in Simba Bhora clash
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
SURPRISE Castle Lager Premier Soccer League log leaders, MWOS will have another stern test of character when they take on defending champions, Simba Bhora at Wadzanayi Stadium this Saturday.
The newly promoted side has had a fairy-tale start to their life in the top flight after securing five wins and two draws to seat at the apex of the log standings after seven weeks.
First, it was Highlanders, the country’s second most successful club, along the way Yadah, Bikita Minerals, former champions FC Platinum and now the country’s most successful club, Dynamos all have failed to stop little-known MWOS.
Only FC Platinum and Bikita Minerals have taken points off the Norton-based side that is just writing another chapter in an ever-entertaining season.
After getting past some opponents with a well-documented history, MWOS face a stern test of character this Saturday when they travel to Wadzanayi Stadium for a date against defending champions Simba Bhora.
Simba are slowly finding their feat this season and have risen to second on the log after a shacky start to their title defence and having released a sizable number of players and title winning coach Tonderai Ndiraya.
However, despite the slow start, some things never changed and Simba Bhora are imperious at home, as they have only let in just one goal this season at their favourite hunting ground.
In the last three years, only two teams have come out of Shamva smiling, with FC Platinum being the only team to beat the champions at Wadzanayi last year after securing a 2-nil victory and Chegutu Pirates also managed a one-nil win in 2002, when Simba were still playing in the Northern Region Division One League.
Fireworks are expected this Saturday when these two clash however match-day eight action starts on Friday with Herentals hosting Green Fuel at Rufaro Stadium.

news.title: Selemani’s stunner secures a point for FC Platinum against Scottland
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
WINGER Jarison Selemani rescued a point for FC Platinum against Scottland in a highly entertaining Castle Lager Premier Soccer League encounter at Rufaro Stadium this Easter Monday.
A lot was expected in the clash between Scottland and FC Platinum and true to script, the match lived up to the billing.
It was a battle between a pragmatic coach and an exuberant one and at the end, they could not be separated.
Mabvuku-based Scottland took the lead in the first half after Vassilli Kawe benefited from some good work from evergreen Khama Billiat.
The goal seemed to awaken the Zvishavane-based side but they could not find the keys to unlock a solid Scottish defence that was until the introduction of winger Jarison Selemani in the second half.
The former Dynamos player unleashed a thunderbolt that was good enough to win any match however this time it rescued a point.
FC Platinum coach Norman Mapeza was content with the draw despite it being his team’s sixth of the season.
“There are so many positives from today’s match. We could have won the match but then again this point is not disappointing and we will get it right next time,” Mapeza said.
His opposite number was also content.
